primary_trope.name: tier_reveal
primary_trope.hook_text: 328 races. 14 dimensions. Where does Spirit World 100 land?
primary_trope.mechanism: Countdown / ranking — inherent escalation and social comparison.

beats.label: HOOK + PROMISE
beats.narration: Should you race Spirit World 100? I rated 328 gravel races on 14 dimensions. Spirit World 100 scored 50 out of 100. Solid tier. Here's what that actually means for your season.
beats.editing_note: STATE THE PREMISE IN 8 SECONDS. Clear value prop: 'I rated 328 races. Here's where this one lands.' This is the 8-second decision window. Viewers who stay past 15s are 58% more likely to finish.
beats.psych_mechanism: Curiosity gap (specific) + IKEA effect (viewer predicts the tier before reveal).

beats.label: THE COURSE
beats.narration: Spirit World 100. Arizona. 100 mi. Arizona desert gravel.
beats.editing_note: Let the course breathe. Show the route map, then cut to terrain-specific B-roll. This is the SETUP phase — grounding the viewer before the data analysis. Pacing: 25-40 sec cuts.

beats.label: THE SCORES — Top 8
beats.narration: Let's go through the scores. Length. 4 out of 5. Bring real food. Not just gels. Race director Heidi Rentz instructs all riders to 'take it down two notches from what they would ride at home on the descents. Logistics. 3 out of 5. Adequate. The word was invented for this. Course requires GPS upload since it's 'lightly marked'—race director Heidi Rentz warns riders 'if you make a wrong turn, you go to Mexico. Adventure. 3 out of 5. This race takes you somewhere different. Experience. 3 out of 5. Memorable course. Has character. Riders consistently describe transformative experiences: 'Total adult summer camp vibe, but way better! Community. 3 out of 5. Good vibes. Riders actually talk to each other. The event achieves '38% female' participation compared to typical cycling's '17% female' according to race director Heidi Rentz. Value. 3 out of 5. Fair value. You get what you pay for. The weekend package extends from Thursday benefit dinners through Sunday recovery rides, including live music, family meals, handmade ceramic mugs, and multiple group ride options. Technicality. 2 out of 5. Your road bike might survive. Might. Elevation. 2 out of 5. Some ups and downs. Manageable. The 'first climb out of Patagonia and up Harshaw Creek Road' provides the main elevation gain before riders traverse the San Rafael Valley's rolling terrain.
beats.editing_note: PROGRESSIVE RHYTHM: start tight (15-20 sec per dimension), slow down for the most interesting scores (30-40 sec). Each score: number appears, brief pause, explanation. Avatar reacts to extreme scores (5/5 = chef_kiss, 1/5 = facepalm). RE-ENGAGEMENT at 3:00 mark: insert a surprising score reveal or a meme reaction to break the pattern.

meme_insert.suggested_clip: avatar reaction to most extreme score

beats.label: THE SCORES — Also Scored
beats.narration: And the rest of the scorecard. Climate. 2 out of 5. Mostly pleasant. Check the forecast anyway. Altitude. 2 out of 5. Mild elevation. Most riders won't notice. Prestige. 2 out of 5. Known in certain circles. Niche following. Race Quality. 2 out of 5. Adequate. Room for improvement. Field Depth. 2 out of 5. Modest field. Some fast riders in the mix. Expenses. 2 out of 5. Your wallet will remember this. Briefly.
beats.editing_note: FAST PACING — 7 seconds per dimension. Quick-fire energy change from the deep analysis above. This is a PATTERN INTERRUPT through pacing shift.

beats.editing_note: Warm energy. Each strength gets its own card. Avatar genuinely positive.

beats.label: VERDICT
beats.narration: Verdict: Arizona Desert 100-Miler. If you're in Arizona/Southwest and want a local 100-miler. yes, it's solid. If you're from out of region. there are better options.
beats.editing_note: CLOSE THE MAIN LOOP. 0.5s silence before verdict. Tier badge slams in. Avatar delivers final take. DO NOT signal 'wrapping up' — maintain energy.
